Method.name: Get
Head
Request
Forge
Method.Implementation:
kill %request, %session, %response new %request, %session, %response
// Makes sure that any attempts to change the namespace internally ends up in the original one. set fromNamespace = ..Namespace set str = ""
merge cookiesJar = i%CookiesJar
set %request = ##class(Forgery.Request).CreateFromSettings(settings, .cookiesJar) set %session = ##class(%CSP.Session).%New(-1, 0) set %response = ##class(%CSP.Response).%New()
try { set appInfo = ..GetApplicationInfoFromUrl(%request.URL) set %request.Application = appInfo.AppUrl if $extract(%request.URL) '= "/" set %request.URL = "/"_%request.URL $$$ThrowOnError(##class(Forgery.OutputCapturer).Capture(appInfo.DispatchClass, %request.URL, settings.method, .response)) do PutReceivedCookiesIntoJar } catch ex { set sc = ex.AsStatus() } kill %request, %session, %response
set $namespace = fromNamespace return sc
PutReceivedCookiesIntoJar set index = "" for { set index = $order(%response.Cookies(index)) quit:index=""
set name = %response.Cookies(index, "n") set value = %response.Cookies(index, "v")
set i%CookiesJar(name, index) = value }

Method.name: GetApplicationInfoFromUrl
Capture
%OnNew
Method.Implementation: set ..URL = url set ..Method = method set ..Content = ##class(%CSP.CharacterStream).%New() do ..LoadDefaultCgiEnvs() return $$$OK

Method.name: CreateFromSettings
AuthorizationSet
Method.Implementation: set i%CgiEnvs("HTTP_AUTHORIZATION") = value set i%Authorization = value return $$$OK

Method.name: ContentTypeSet
Method.Implementation: set i%CgiEnvs("HTTP_CONTENT_TYPE") = value set i%ContentType = value return $$$OK

Method.name: ContentLengthSet
Method.Implementation: set i%CgiEvs("CONTENT_LENGTH") = value set i%ContentLength = value return $$$OK

Method.name: LoadDefaultCgiEnvs
Method.Implementation:
do ##class(%Net.URLParser).Parse(..URL, .components) do ParseQueryString(components("query"), .data)
merge i%Data = data
set i%CgiEnvs("REQUEST_METHOD") = $$$ucase(..Method) set i%CgiEnvs("REQUEST_SCHEME") = "http" set i%CgiEnvs("REQUEST_URI") = components("path") set i%CgiEnvs("SERVER_NAME") = "localhost" set i%CgiEnvs("SERVER_PORT") = 57772 set i%CgiEnvs("SERVER_PROTOCOL") = "HTTP/1.1"
ParseQueryString(qs, data) if qs = "" quit
set qp = $lfs(qs, "&")
for i=1:1:$ll(qp) { set key = $piece($lg(qp, i), "=", 1) set value = $piece($lg(qp, i), "=", 2) if key '= "" && (value '= "") set data(key, 1) = value } quit

UDLText.name: T
UDLText.Content: // Most of the methods below are a copy from %CSP.Request, since we need to keep

UDLText.name: T
UDLText.Content: // these methods working as they can be called by the application.

Method.name: InsertCookie
Method.Implementation: If name="" Quit $$$OK do ..SetCgiEnv("HTTP_"_$$$ucase($replace(name, "-", "_")), value) Set i%Cookies(name,$order(i%Cookies(name,""),-1)+1)=value Quit

Method.name: IsDefinedCookie
Method.Description: Returns true if the named cookie exists in the cookie collection, false otherwise.

Method.name: GetMimeData
Method.Description: Retrieves the named multipart MIME stream.

Method.name: InsertMimeData
Method.Description: Inserts a multipart MIME stream by name into the collection.

Method.name: IsDefinedMimeData
Method.Description: Returns true if the named multipart MIME stream exists in the collection, false otherwise.

Method.name: CountMimeData
Method.Description: Returns the count of multipart MIME streams with this name.
Method.Implementation:
#Dim count,i
Quit:'$data(i%MimeData(name)) 0 Set count=0 Set i="" For Set i=$order(i%MimeData(name,i)) Quit:i="" Set count=count+1 Quit count

Method.name: NextMimeData
Method.Description: Retrieves name of the next multipart MIME stream stored in the request object.

Method.name: NextMimeDataIndex
Method.Description: Return the index number of the next multipart MIME stream stored in the request object.

Method.name: DeleteMimeData
Method.Description: Removes this multipart MIME stream from the collection. Returns the number of nodes it has removed. If <var>name</var> is not defined then it will remove the entire set of MimeData, if <var>name</var> is defined but <var>index</var> is not then it will remove all items stored under <var>name</var>.

Method.name: InsertCgiEnv
Method.Description: Inserts a CGI environment variable by name into the collection.

Method.name: GetCgiEnv
Method.Description: Retrieves the named CGI environment variable.

Method.name: IsDefinedCgiEnv
Method.Description: Returns true if the named CGI environment variable exists in the collection, false otherwise.

Method.name: NextCgiEnv
Method.Description: Retrieves the next CGI environment variable name in the sequence

Method.name: DeleteCgiEnv
Method.Description: Removes this CGI environment variable from the collection, returns true if the item was defined and false if it was never defined.

Method.name: SetHeader
Method.Implementation:
if $$$lcase(key) = "content-type" set ..ContentType = value if $$$lcase(key) = "content-length" set ..ContentLength = value
do ..SetCgiEnv("HTTP_"_$$$ucase($replace(key, "-", "_")), value) return $$$OK

Method.name: Count
Method.Implementation: #Dim count,i Quit:'$data(i%Data(name)) 0 Set count=0 Set i="" For Set i=$order(i%Data(name,i)) Quit:i="" Set count=count+1 Quit count

Method.name: Find
Method.Implementation: #Dim i Set i=$order(i%Data(name,"")) While (i'="")&&(i%Data(name,i)'=value) { Set i=$order(i%Data(name,i)) } Quit i
